How can they talk her down safely?

programme.title: Tickety Toc
programme.desc: Tommy and Tallulah offer to do the polishing so that Madame Au Lait can make their favourite fruity trifle. While she is out buying the ingredients, the twins go polish crazy, thinking that the more they use the happier Madame Au Lait will be and the more trifle she will make. The clockhouse is gleaming when Madame Au Lait returns, but when she sets a hoof on the floor she finds that it as slippery as an ice rink.

programme.title: Tickety Toc
programme.desc: The twins are asked to collect McCogginss bell for a town performance. Despite Battersbys warning that the clapper is fragile and doesnt have a spare, Tommy and Tallulah manage to break it. Deciding that they must make a replacement, they look everywhere for something to use and try some very unusual options. Will the bell be ready for Chime Time?

programme.title: Tickety Toc
programme.desc: When Tommy and Tallulah agree to babysit the spring chicks while Madame Au Lait tends to Mother Chicks hurt wing, they dont realise that how much of a handful the chicks will be. The twins are also taking part in the town kite display today, but somehow the chicks end up surfing on their kite, high in the sky! The twins must stage an airborne rescue before Chime Time.

programme.title: Tickety Toc
programme.desc: Tommy and Tallulah are organising McCogginss pile of interesting junk when a vitally important spring goes missing. They cant chime the time without it! The twins chase the spring all over town as it bounces around causing chaos, eventually ending up attaching Pufferty to his kennel. Every time he tries to go somewhere, the spring pulls him back.

programme.title: Tickety Toc
programme.desc: McCoggins tells the twins not to stray far, but they forget to warn Pufferty when they try to teach him how to play hide and seek. There are not many places in Tickety Town big enough to hide a huge dog train, so Pufferty heads far off into the hills. Where can he be? The race is on to find him by Chime Time.

programme.title: Tickety Toc
programme.desc: Tommy and Tallulah find harvesting very slow when they volunteer to pick Lopsiloos vegetables. Surely there must be some way to speed it up? However, when they hit upon the idea of using Pufferty to pull all the vegetables up at once, they are shocked to find that Puffertys carriages unhook and run amok through Tickety Town.

programme.title: Tickety Toc
programme.desc: Tickety Town is covered in fallen leaves, so Tommy and Tallulah are using McCogginss new prototype street sweeper to clear them. However, in their eagerness to speed things up, they go against his instructions and press the turbo button. Suddenly, the sweeper goes haywire, rampaging through town and sucking up anything in its path, including Madame Au Laits clock key and very nearly Hopparoo too.

programme.title: Tickety Toc
programme.desc: The whole town gathers to take part in McCoggins treasure hunt. Whoever finds the most cogs will be the winner. Knowing that McCoggins hides the cogs in the same places every year, Tommy and Tallulah are cruising to victory, until they realise that a quick win will spoil everyones day, but when they borrow McCoggins special clockwork rollerskates to put the cogs back, the skates zoom out of control.

programme.title: Tickety Toc
programme.desc: The twins decide that everyone must get active and turn Tickety town into a boot camp. With Tommy banging his drum and Tallulah blowing on her trumpet, soon everyone is lifting, running, puffing and panting. They are all so exhausted that they fall fast asleep, but with Chime Time imminent, they must find a way to wake up Puffertys wheels.

programme.title: Tickety Toc
programme.desc: When Hopparoo bursts all their bubbles with his sharp ears, the twins use McCoggins extra-strong bubble mixture instead and blow a bubble so huge that it engulfs Battersby, Madame Au Lait, McCoggins, Lopsiloo, Chikidee and finally Tommy and Tallulah themselves! Where is Hopparoo? Only his sharp ears can free them for Chime Time.

programme.title: Tickety Toc
programme.desc: Tommy and Tallulah love dressing up and surprising each other with their crazy costumes, but when they decide to surprise everybody else in town too Hopparoo is not impressed. In their efforts to surprise the bunny, they give the Spring Chicks such a fright that they barricade themselves in front of the clockhouse, blocking the way to Chime Time.

programme.title: Tickety Toc
programme.desc: Madame Au Lait is teaching the twins pottery, and to inspire them she shows them a magnificent cow pot that she made on her wheel, but when she leaves them to their enthusiastic pot-making, they accidentally smash it and when they try to repair it, they only make things worse. Trying to re-create the pot is even more of a disaster. Huge quantities of clay fly from their wheel into the town, blocking Puffertys tracks.

programme.title: Tickety Toc
programme.desc: Hopparoo is disappointed when everyone gathers for Measuring Time. He was sure hed grown more than that! Tommy and Tallulah have some crazy ideas about how to add inches, but a super-tall rabbit rampaging through town on stilts can only cause chaos.

programme.title: 64 Zoo Lane
programme.desc: Joey the kangaroo and his friend love playing boomerang ball together. However when their mums fall out they are no longer allowed to play with each other. Can the friends work together to reconcile their mums so that they can play again?

programme.desc: Section 20 special-ops soldiers Thomas "Mac" McAllister, Samuel Wyatt and Gracie Novin are sent to investigate the crash of a Russian bomber in the South China Sea. While in Malaysia, their paths cross with Katrina Zarkova, a rogue Russian operative whose loyalties remain in question. New commanding officer Col Alexander Coltrane orders Section 20 to track stolen contents of the Russian jet across Southeast Asia, a process that eventually uncovers a conspiracy that threatens to push the world to the brink of global conflict.

programme.title: Grimm
programme.desc: On the trail of a murderer, Nick and Hank learn that their suspect is being harbored by Monroe and Rosalee.

programme.title: Warehouse 13
programme.desc: Myka and Peter ease into their roles at Warehouse 13, discovering the treasures it holds, and meet Lena, the proprietor of a BandB near the base.

programme.title: Nothing to Declare
programme.desc: Follow Australian Customs and Border Protection officers as they attempt to enforce the countrys various quarantine, customs, immigration and finance laws.

programme.title: Brit Cops: War on Crime
programme.desc: Lincolnshire police might reap a bumper harvest in a drugs raid and deal with a multiple vehicle pileup on a busy road.

programme.title: The Force: North East
programme.desc: An emergency dash results in a serious collision between the police van and a taxi. Plus, officers race to save a suicidal man.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Dr Amandas team loses a pangolin abused by wildlife traffickers, but another is released post-rehab. Checking on a trio of hedgehogs and tag along as the centres baboons and nyala antelopes get a change of scenery.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Dr Amanda attempts to collar a wild roan antelope. Later, she chase down a blue monkey while unrest ensues among the vervets. She examines an eagle owl with bumblefoot and says goodbye to Sheila the croc who isheaded back to the wild.

programme.title: Ocean Parks
programme.desc: Deep in the South Caribbean Sea, explore the protected waters of Bonaire National Marine Park, home to thriving reefs, endangered sea turtles, sprawling mangroves, and a plethora of marine life.

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Dr Alison Cronin and animal manager Jeremy return from a trip to Argentina with Sasha and Kangoo, two chimpanzees are given a new home at the park, and Tuans orangutans receive a treat.

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: There are plenty of comings and goings at the park as a marmoset family heads to a new home, Tya returns looking for love, and the Barn Woollies welcome baby Xenia to their tight-knit group.

programme.title: Rooted
programme.desc: In the grasslands of southern Kalahari stands a 200 year old Acacia. In this arid landscape the Camelthorn is a sanctuary for big and small. Sociable weavers, Bruchid beetles and various mammals make use of this iconic tree.

programme.title: My Best Friends An Animal
programme.desc: Embrace an invasive nutria who has become part of the family, paddle around with Gumbo the goose, visit a blind hedgehog and his human chum, explore a swimmers bond with wild grey seals, and hang out with Cosima the monkey and Jasper the serval.

programme.title: Wild Wild East
programme.desc: Non-native species have made their way into the Wild Wild East and staked their claim to the jagged coast. At White Point Beach Resort in Liverpool, Nova Scotia bunnies have hopped on in for an extended holiday.

programme.title: Wild Wild East
programme.desc: In the woodland caribou of Gros Morne, the changing seasons offer a stern test for the wildlife. Even the arctic-ready muskoxen of north Quebec is challenged to find food in the whitest terrain.

programme.title: Irelands Wild Islands with Eoin Warner
programme.desc: Eoin visits a wondrous native woodland on Clare Island and as he sails his Galway Hooker through Connemaras turquoise waters he finds deserted islands home to skylarks and on the Aran Islands, Irelands only native reptile.

programme.title: True Crime Story: Citizen Detective
programme.desc: A young girls life was thrown into chaos when her single mother died by a gunshot wound in their remote mountain home. The journey for the truth will be long and arduous and itll be thirty years until justice will finally be served.

programme.title: Facing Evil
programme.desc: 20 patients at a Texas hospital are murdered. Nurse Vickie Jackson is sentenced to life. She now says shes innocent and knows who the real killer is.

programme.title: Facing Evil
programme.desc: An elderly lady and her care taker are murdered. Earl Linebaugh and Melissa Harris are sentenced to life with no parole, but Melissa says shes a victim too.

programme.title: Facing Evil
programme.desc: Baby Dylan was 3 months old when his mum shook him to death. She claims it was an accident but was found guilty of murder and sentenced to 50 years.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Shopping from home.

programme.title: Murder UK
programme.desc: In 1998, Scottish entrepreneur Nat Frasers odd behaviour raises suspicion when his wife Arlene vanishes. Police suspect him but need evidence.

programme.title: Uncovering Melanies Murderer
programme.desc: A study in modern crime solving techniques, used in the search for the 1984 killer of teenage Melanie. It demonstrates how traditional investigative techniques are enhanced by DNA profiling. Including interviews with the original investigation team.

programme.title: 48 Hours
programme.desc: A retired UPS driver reveals new details about cult leader David Koresh and what led up to the deadly standoff with law enforcement nearly 25 years ago.

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: A young couple are killed in what appears to be a drug deal gone wrong, but at tests reveal that the couple were clean. Can their pet dog Chief lead the police to the real culprits?

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: It started as a fairy tale: boy meets girl, they fall in love, get engaged and she falls pregnant. What if he then plots her death and tries to poison her?

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: To his neighbours, Faryion Wardrip was a good natured Sunday school teacher, but he was also a brutal serial killer, and a discarded cup brought about his capture.

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: Philadelphia police were called to an abandoned car and found the female drivers dead body the following day. Unusual marks on her corpse led police to the killer.

programme.title: Storm of Suspicion
programme.desc: In a remote Louisiana field, Brian Daviss body is found at what seems to be an attempted robbery scene. However, a timely afternoon rainstorm uncovers an elaborate plot.

programme.title: Storm of Suspicion
programme.desc: A powerful thunderstorm hits a small Illinois town overnight as a wealthy couple is shot dead in their sleep. Detectives face challenges from the weather while searching for clues, but the storm may provide unexpected leads to catch the killer.

programme.title: 48 Hours
programme.desc: An entrepreneur makes a deal with a Silicon Valley businessman who is looking to invest in the wine scene in Napa Valley. Worth $800,000, the deal results in a murder.

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: When a Presbyterian minister called 911, medics found his wife dying in the bathtub, having ingested large quantities of medication. Was it murder or suicide?

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: A girl on her way back from a rock concert blew a tyre on her truck. The police found the vehicle, but no trace of her. Three years later, they made a grisly discovery.

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: A young dancer was elated to gain a place at the Houston High School for Performing Arts, but she fell in with a bad crowd, and suddenly disappeared without a trace.

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: Phillip Rouss Jr had it all family, friends and a thriving business. Until his health began to deteriorate. Tests revealed he was being poisoned, but by whom?

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: A landlord goes after an allegedly delinquent tenant when the police notify him of disturbances on his property.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Dont Fence Me In!; Sister, I Dont Believe You!; Mess or No Mess?!
programme.desc: A man goes after his neighbours for alleged damage to his fence; the integrity of two sisters sworn statements is questioned following an accident; a tenant claims a broken refrigerator caused her to throw out hundreds of dollars worth of food.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Hair Salon Rip-Off!; Cousins Go Dutch on Rent?; Friends Fallout!
programme.desc: A salon owner claims a stylist left without paying rent; a man accuses his cousin of not paying rent and stealing his clothes; teacher sues her former friend for an unpaid loan to fix up an RV and her friend countersues for emotional distress.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: The Danger of Dog Parks!; Study Abroad Misfire; Friends Dont Let Friends Borrow Money
programme.desc: Dog owners fight over liability when an unleashed greyhound is injured; a dispute over a leased car; a mother is sued by a former friend for an unpaid loan and lost wages.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Time Share Fiasco!; Bad Luck Car Sale
programme.desc: A woman wants her daughters ex-boyfriend to repay her for a failed time-share vacation; a man is on the hook for towing fees after selling a car to an unlicensed driver.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Savage Dog Attack!; Medical Treatment Disaster

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on a scenic, thousand-mile rail journey from the Swedish capital, Stockholm, to Abisko in the northern reaches of the Arctic Circle. Steered by his 1936 edition of Bradshaws Continental Railway Guide, Michael boards a steam train to celebrate Midsummer in Marielund, learns to decorate a Dala horse in Mora and takes an icy dip in one of the countrys 96,000 lakes.

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael begins his American adventure on Manhattan Island. Starting at New Yorks Grand Central Terminal, he boards the Manhattan subway system, the busiest rail transit system in the US.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A beautiful looking sports car has been fooling the punters and intriguing Derek. Its a Challenger E-Type - a fibreglass replica created from an E-Type mould.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Paul and Jack head to Staffordshire to pick up five vehicles from collector Robs colossal barn, including a Mini and a Morris Minor.

programme.title: True Evil: Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: Albert Speer, the apolitical architect whose desire to build grand buildings leads him to sell his soul.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The man responsible for the massacre of US soldiers in Malmedy, Joachim Peiper, becomes the hunted as Allied forces attempt to track him down.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: The team make a return visit to the Spa town of Harrogate in Yorkshire. Fiona Bruce and the experts are at the Royal Hall which has played host to stars like the Beatles and Duke Ellington. Top of the bill is a little ink drawing that Phillip Mould believes could be by the hand of Pablo Picasso.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team head to Scotland for another busy day of evaluations at the impressive Kelvingrove Art Gallery and Museum. Objects exciting the experts include handsome jewels from `aunties treasure trove that evoke a luxurious lifestyle from the art deco era.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek, with help from the Mathewson clan, drag a mini pickup out of the barn where its been for 20 years, and a 350cc Douglas Mark V motorbike from 1950 goes under the hammer.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Four VW camper vans pitch up at the auction house looking for a new home and Derek picks up an Austin 16 that goes like stink and has some unusual modern modifications.

programme.title: True Evil: Making of a Nazi

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The man responsible for the massacre of US soldiers in Malmedy, Joachim Peiper, becomes the hunted as Allied forces attempt to track him down.

programme.title: Cornwall with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon journeys through some of the most beautiful coastal locations Britain has to offer and meets the incredible Cornish characters who make the county unique.

programme.title: Indian Ocean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon Reeves journey around the spectacular Indian Ocean takes him from Oman to the Maldives. He starts in the remote and otherworldly Musandam peninsula on the Strait of Hormuz, one of the most strategically important waterways in the world, where oil from the Persian Gulf is shipped through the narrow channel out into the Indian Ocean. The journey takes him on to Mumbai, the Indian Oceans biggest port.

programme.title: The Lakes with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon meets some of the Cumbrian characters with different visions for the future of Englands biggest National Park, including a campaign group trying to protect the remaining red squirrel populations.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek, with help from the Mathewson clan, drag a mini pickup out of the barn where its been for 20 years, and a 350cc Douglas Mark V motorbike from 1950 goes under the hammer.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A beautiful looking sports car has been fooling the punters and intriguing Derek. Its a Challenger E-Type - a fibreglass replica created from an E-Type mould.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon and Henry head to Wiltshire. Henry is feeling happy because theyre going to an old WWII airfield. Simon decides to restore a 1970s caravan while Henry opts for a boat.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Explore Oradour-sur-Glane, a French town drenched in infamy, the victim of a notorious raid, Alcatraz, a facility famed for breakouts, subjected to a daring break-in, and Sealand, a micronation off the English coast, stormed by a band of mercenaries.

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael begins in the port of Batumi on the dazzling Caucasian Riviera. He savours the soul of Georgia in its wine and discovers a surprise nineteenth century tea plantation in the West Georgian countryside. The seat of power beckons in Kutaisi, home to the wonderful glass dome built for the Parliament of Georgia when it moved here from the capital, Tbilisi, in 2012.

programme.title: Dhoom
programme.desc: A gang of robbers on hi-tech motorbikes, led by the charismatic Kabir, is sweeping through Mumbai, outwitting the police at every turn. When officer Jai Dixit is assigned to catch the criminals, he reluctantly enlists the help of garage mechanic and bike enthusiast Ali. Though the pair do not see eye-to-eye at first, they soon become a formidable team, tracking their enemies from the streets of Mumbai to the beaches of Goa.

programme.title: Dear Dad
programme.desc: A teenager and his father form a special bond with each other while on an unplanned road trip from their home in Delhi to the formers boarding school in Mussoorie.

programme.title: Daulat
programme.desc: Honest employee, Ghanshyam gets framed for murder by Joseph DSouza, and has to flee from the police.

programme.title: Kis Kisko Pyaar Karoon
programme.desc: A man marries three women who live in the same building and are friends but are unaware that they have the same husband. His wives end up getting invited to his fourth wedding.

programme.title: Dishoom
programme.desc: Two cops, Kabir and Junaid, go on a mission to rescue Viraj, a leading cricketer, who has been kidnapped by Wagah, a bookie, and his associate.

programme.title: Faasle
programme.desc: When Vijay meets Chandni, they immediately decide to marry, but Chandnis father, Vikram, based on a previous encounter with Vijay, refuses to accept the engagement.

programme.title: Mujhse Dosti Karoge!
programme.desc: A man falls in love with his childhood friend, but her sister is the one who reciprocates his feelings.

programme.title: Sholay
programme.desc: The tale of one mans fight for justice. In an act of retribution, cold-blooded criminal Gabbar Singh massacres the family of a police officer, Thakur Baldev. Left crippled by his enemy, Thakur is hungry for revenge but, seeing no way of bringing Gabbar to book, he hires two petty crooks, Veeru and Jai.

programme.title: Ek Villain
programme.desc: Guru blurs the line between good and evil as he pursues his lovers killers.

programme.title: Shor Se Shuruaat
programme.desc: An anthology of seven short films that revolve around the theme of noise, and depict real-life issues. Each segment has been made by a different director.

programme.desc: Amidst a symphony of happiness, drama, and complications, love thrives in relationships across different generations within the household of a quintessential Udaipur joint family.

programme.desc: Embracing love above all, strong-willed Saas-Bahus keep the Viranis together. But when conspirators try to create a rift, will their familial bond prevail?
